description: The fifth edition of the world's most popular tabletop role-playing game.
customRules: This section can contain general house rules or specific system mechanics not covered by structured data. For example: 'Advantage/Disadvantage rules: When you have advantage, you roll two d20s and take the higher result. When you have disadvantage, you roll two d20s and take the lower result.'

attributes.name: Strength
attributes.description: Measures bodily power, athletic training, and the extent to which you can exert raw physical force.

attributes.name: Constitution
attributes.description: Measures health, stamina, and vital force.

attributes.name: Intelligence
attributes.description: Measures mental acuity, accuracy of recall, and the ability to reason.

attributes.name: Wisdom
attributes.description: Measures your attunement to the world, perceptiveness, and intuition.

attributes.name: Charisma
attributes.description: Measures your ability to interact effectively with others, force of personality, and social influence.

feats.name: Alert
feats.description: You gain a +5 bonus to initiative. You can't be surprised while you are conscious. Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

feats.name: Great Weapon Master
feats.description: Before you make a melee attack with a heavy weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

feats.name: Lucky
feats.description: You have 3 luck points. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend one luck point to roll an additional d20.

feats.name: Sharpshooter
feats.description: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls. Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover. Before you make an attack with a ranged weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

feats.name: Tough
feats.description: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a level thereafter, your hit point maximum increases by an additional 2 hit points.

classes.name: Barbarian
classes.description: A fierce warrior of primitive background who can enter a battle rage.

classes.name: Bard
classes.description: An inspiring magician whose music and words are used to affect emotions and minds.

classes.name: Cleric
classes.description: A priestly champion who wields divine magic in service of a higher power.

races.name: Human
races.description: The most common and adaptable of ancestries.

races.name: Elf
races.description: A magical people of otherworldly grace, living in the world but not entirely part of it.

races.name: Dwarf
races.description: A stout folk, strong and hardy, known for their skill in mining and smithing.

backgrounds.name: Acolyte
backgrounds.description: You have spent your life in the service of a temple or a particular deity.

backgrounds.name: Charlatan
backgrounds.description: You have always been a con artist and a trickster.

spellListExample.name: Fire Bolt
spellListExample.description: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range.

spellListExample.name: Magic Missile
spellListExample.description: You create three glowing darts of magical force.

magicSystem.spellcastingRules: This section can describe general spellcasting rules, spell slots, components, etc.
